content.rendered:
Convergences organizes for the fifth time its European and International Awards.

The Convergences Awards reward the best parnerships betwenn a solidar entity with a public and/or private entity to develop innovative projects with a strong social or environmental impact.

For this fifth edition, Convergences pre-selected 22 applications amongst the 36 applications received.

14 applications were eligible for the International Award, and 8 for the European Award. The projects and partnerships have been judged by a Jury composed of representatives from the public, private and solidar sector, and the Nominees for each category have been selected.

The three Nominees for the International Award :

  1. The project Novo Ciclo, a partnership between Instituto Nenuca de Desenvolvimento Sustentável (Brazil) and the Danone Ecosystem Fund – The project is conducted under an innovatve recycling business model based on cooperative organization. It aims at providing recycling trainings and a logistical and technical support to waste pickers in Brazil in order to promote a sustainable waste management system.
  1. The project Charbon Typha Mauritanie, a patnership between Gret and  the Rosso Institute of Technology Studies (Mauritania) – The project aims at reducing deforestation caused by the charcoal production by promoting coal production based on the combustion of typha, an invasive aquatic species. The project creates new economic opportunities in Mauritania through renewable energies.
  1. The project Zurich Flood Resilience Program, a partnership between the International Federation of Red Cross and Red Crescent Societies, the NGO Practical Action, the research NGO International Institute of Applied Systems Analysis (IIASA) and the Wharton Risk and Decision Processes Center of the University of Pennsylvania with the Zurich Insurance Group – The project, through an innovative collaboration model, aims at developing and implementing a sustainable flood risk prevention and resilience system.

The four Nominees for the European Award :

  1. The project Tutorat Passeport Avenir, a partnership between the association Passeport Avenir and the company Accenture – The project aims at supporting young people from humble backgrounds in their educational and professional career.
  1. The project PIMMS, a partenrship between Union nationale des PIMMS and the French national electricity company EDF – The project aims at facilitating access to essential services.
  1. The project Innover et co-construire pour créer l’entreprise de demain, a partnership between Agence du Don en Nature and the Groupe Galeries Lafayette – The project aims at promoting financial sponsorship and product donations in a cicrular economy system and in a responsible and inclusive approach.
  1. The project ActiVIDA, a partnership between the association Siel Bleu Spain and the Danone Ecosystem Fund – The project aims at preserving and improving the health and autonomy of elderly people in Spain thanks to adapted physical trainings and nutritional monitoring.

The Nominees will present their project before the Jury for the Final on Wednesday 3 June 2015 in Paris.

The Laureates of the Convergences International and European Award will be announced on the official Awards Ceremony on 9 September 2015 during the 8th Convergences World Forum.
